author: BIONICLEGuy
title: Amazing, but the instructions?
review:
I got this set for Xmas this year, the game & pieces are amazing but the instructions tell you nothing.
They just help you put the microfigs & robots in place & you have to do the rest without instructions.
Onto pros & cons!

Pros-
The game is really fun.
Rare pieces.
Good microfigs.

Cons-
The instructions tell you nothing.
The model is pretty hard to build.

Overall, I would recommend this set to someone who actually wants it & will have fun with it.

author: Elwood
title: Great game for kids who like lego space stuff
review:
This game is really cool, and encourages kids to build and create their own space stations.

 

The pieces of the set are cool and as a built set looks very good.

 

The only problem is that the games rules seem to do too much. You score points for building space stations with different parts, you have to move robots or spacemen back to your station, you then score point for getting them back to your scoring zone whilst your spaceman move a step closer to the space ship! I am sorry if this sounds confusing, but it's because it IS! The intructions are dubius too.

 

However, the beautiful thing with Lego Games is... You can change the rule to suit you.

 

If you already have Space Lego try adding it to you set and make the game more interesting.

author: Savage_Steel
title: A clever, strategic board game, with added lego fun.
review:
I was surprised to see the score for this set was so low, despite the only other reviewer seemingly to like the game.

Me and the hubby have just had a great, tactical, and slightly back-stabbing game, and thoroughly enjoyed it.

The rules, as with most lego games weren't obvious, but with a bit of thought the objective (to build walled stations and enclose or move robots and astronauts into them) are clearer.
The fun is really in messing with your opposition's plans. Maybe that's not to everyone's tastes, but if you can resist arguing it creates a great competition.

The game really takes off in the second half, when the first stations are complete, and you realise you can enclose points rather then moving them into your station. And you can steal your opposition's half finished station too. Blocking with UFOs also adds to the nastiness. ;-)
I'm sure kids would play nicely, but maybe not!

We haven't yet messed withe the rules, but I suspect we'll add a few bits in the long run.

I enjoyed this game, A) because it was strategic and played well
B) it's a good 2 player game (most 2 player board games take too long to play or not involved/strategic enough)
C) there's some nice lego pieces, nothing too unusual I suspect, but I liked the green/orange combo.

My favourite lego game so far.

(ps I got it for £15 instead of the RRP of £20 - £15 seems about right)
